attributes.action: question Culture Minister, Margaret Hodge, on her ability to make decisions on the listing of 20C architecture, and require her to take more note of advisors at English Heritage and the 20th Century Society.
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Margaret Hodge has a dismally poor record when it comes to taking the advice of experts at EH and the 20thC society on matters related to 20thC architecture... Preston Bus Station and Birmingham Central Library have both recently been turned down for listing by Margaret Hodge, despite recommendations from EH. 

English Heritage recommended Birmingham library be listed Grade II. But the Commission for Architecture and the Built Environment disagreed, and its apparently influential role in Ms Hodge's decision has alarmed Twentieth Century Society director, Catherine Croft. "Cabe does not have any historic building expertise," she said.

She said that the Culture minister had given too much weight to public and commercial opinions.

rejection.details: This is a matter for direct communication with the Department for Culture Media and Sport in the first instance.
reasons: Issues for which an e-petition is not the appropriate channel
